item.title: Tidy Tuesday- MD Spending on Children
item.description: For this TidyTuesday Challenge we worked with a dataset provied by Joshua Rosenberg (https://twitter.com/jrosenberg6432) showing categories of public spending on children in the US by state and year. I limited the date to Maryland and the years of 2011-2016 and used a “bumpchart” to look at the ranking of categories of spending over time (from most money to least money spent). Maryland consistently spent the most money on PK-12 Education, followed by other healh services excluding Medicaid/CHIP.

item.title: About
item.description: My name is Joanna Prout and I began my professional career as a social worker, then received my PhD in clinical psychology. I am passionate about using data to improve behavioral healthcare. This my website to post #TidyTuesday and other #rstats projects. This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.

item.title: Tidy Tuesday for 9/1/2020
item.description: For this Tidy Tuesday challenge we used data files from Our World in Data describing crop yields across the globe from 1960-present. Data can be found at https://ourworldindata.org/crop-yields Peas seemed appealing at the time and I never see them growing here in Maryland– where do they come from? I plotted a line graph with tons of peas produced per hectare on the y-axis, year (range from 1990 to 2020) on the x-axis, and continent as line color.
